articles.title: 50+ angielskich zdrobnie≈Ñ, kt√≥re roztopiƒÖ serce
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Uzywanie pieszczotliwych zwrotow w jƒôzyku partnera to wspanialy spos√≥b na poglebienie waszej wiezci. Angielski ma bogata tradycje zdrobnien - od klasycznych po zabawne. Jezeli uczysz siƒô [jak powiedziec "kocham cie" po angielsku](/learn/pl/en/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-english/), te zwroty sƒÖ idealnym uzupelnieniem!

## Kiedy u≈ºywaƒá angielskich zdrobnie≈Ñ

Zanim przejdziemy do listy, warto wiedzieƒá, kiedy kt√≥re zdrobnienia sƒÖ odpowiednie:

| Kontekst | Odpowiednie zdrobnienia | Unikaj |
|----------|------------------------|--------|
| **W domu, na osobno≈õci** | Wszystkie - od "baby" po "sexy" | - |
| **Przy rodzinie partnera** | "darling", "sweetheart", "honey" | "babe", "sexy", "hot stuff" |
| **W miejscach publicznych** | "honey", "dear", "love" | Zbyt intymne zwroty |
| **W wiadomo≈õciach tekstowych** | "babe", "sweetie", skr√≥ty jak "‚ù§Ô∏è" | Zbyt d≈Çugie zdrobnienia |
| **W pracy (je≈õli partner jest wsp√≥≈Çpracownikiem)** | Imiƒô lub neutralne zwroty | Wszystkie zdrobnienia |

<CultureTip title="Brytyjczycy vs Amerykanie" flag="üá¨üáß">
W UK "love" i "dear" sƒÖ u≈ºywane nawet do nieznajomych w sklepach! W USA to by≈Çoby dziwne. Je≈õli tw√≥j partner jest Brytyjczykiem, nie dziw siƒô, gdy us≈Çyszysz "Cheers, love" do kasjera.
</CultureTip>

## Klasyczne angielskie zdrobnienia

<VocabCard
  word="darling"
  translation="kochanie / najdrozszy/a"
  pronunciation="darling"
  example="Hello, darling! How was your day?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="sweetheart"
  translation="skarbie / kochanie"
  pronunciation="s≈Çitheart"
  example="Come here, sweetheart."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="honey"
  translation="kochanie (dosl. miod)"
  pronunciation="hani"
  example="Honey, I'm home!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Skad siƒô biora angielskie zdrobnienia?" flag="üá¨üáß">
Wiele angielskich zdrobnien pochodzi od slodkich rzeczy (honey, sugar, sweetie) lub cennych przedmiotow (treasure, precious). To odzwierciedla, jak bardzo cenimy ukochana osobe!
</CultureTip>

## Zdrobnienia "slodkie"

Anglicy uwielbiaja porownywac ukochane osoby do slodkosci:

<PhraseOfDay
  word="sugar"
  translation="cukiereczku / kochanie"
  pronunciation="szuger"
  context="Bardzo popularne w USA, zwlaszcza na poludniu"
/>

| Angielski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| **sweetie** | s≈Çiti | slodki/a |
| **sugar** | szuger | cukiereczku |
| **honey bunch** | hani bancz | kochanie |
| **sweet pea** | s≈Çit pi | slodka groszkowa (zdrobnienie) |
| **cupcake** | kapkejk | babeczko |

## Zdrobnienia zwierzece

Anglicy czesto uzywaja nazw uroczych zwierzat:

<VocabCard
  word="baby"
  translation="kochanie / male≈Ñstwo"
  pronunciation="bejbi"
  example="Baby, you look beautiful tonight."
/>

| Angielski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| **baby** | bejbi | male≈Ñstwo |
| **babe** | bejb | kochanie (nieformalne) |
| **bunny** | bani | kr√≥liczku |
| **kitten** | kiten | kotku |
| **love bug** | law bag | robaczku milosci |

<CultureTip title="'Baby' i 'Babe'" flag="üá∫üá∏">
"Baby" i "babe" to jedne z najpopularniejszych zdrobnien w USA. "Babe" jest bardziej nowoczesne i swobodne, podczas gdy "baby" jest bardziej tradycyjne.
</CultureTip>

## Zdrobnienia dla mezczyzn

<VocabCard
  word="handsome"
  translation="przystojniaku"
  pronunciation="hendsam"
  example="Good morning, handsome!"
/>

| Angielski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| **handsome** | hendsam | przystojniaku |
| **big guy** | big gaj | wielkoludzie |
| **stud** | stad | ogierze (nieformalne) |
| **prince** | prins | ksiazeciu |
| **king** | king | krolu |

## Zdrobnienia dla kobiet

<VocabCard
  word="beautiful"
  translation="piƒôkna"
  pronunciation="bjutiful"
  example="Hey beautiful, I missed you."
/>

| Angielski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| **beautiful** | bjutiful | piƒôkna |
| **gorgeous** | gordzas | przepiƒôkna |
| **princess** | prinses | ksiezniczko |
| **queen** | k≈Çin | krolowo |
| **angel** | ejndzel | aniele |

## Zabawne i unikalne zdrobnienia

Wiele par tworzy w≈Çasne, unikalne zdrobnienia:

<VocabCard
  word="goofball"
  translation="gluptasie"
  pronunciation="gufbol"
  example="You're such a goofball, I love it."
/>

| Angielski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| **goofball** | gufbol | gluptasie |
| **weirdo** | ≈Çirdo | dziwaku (czule) |
| **munchkin** | manczkin | maluszku |
| **pumpkin** | pampkin | dynieczko |
| **snookums** | snukams | kochaniutki |

## Brytyjskie vs. amerykanskie zdrobnienia

<CultureTip title="Roznice kulturowe" flag="üá¨üáß">
Brytyjczycy czesto uzywaja "love" i "dear" nawet do nieznajomych! "Cheers, love" w sklepie jest calkowicie normalne. Amerykanie sƒÖ bardziej powsciagliwi wobec nieznajomych.
</CultureTip>

### Typowo brytyjskie:
- **"love"** [law] - bardzo powszechne, nawet do nieznajomych
- **"dear"** [dier] - klasyczne, lekko staromodne
- **"pet"** [pet] - popularne na polnocy Anglii
- **"duck"** [dak] - regionalne (Midlands)

### Typowo amerykanskie:
- **"honey"** [hani] - bardzo popularne
- **"babe"** [bejb] - nowoczesne, swobodne
- **"sugar"** [szuger] - popularne na poludniu USA
- **"pumpkin"** [pampkin] - slodkie, rodzinne

## Jak uzywac zdrobnien naturalnie

### Na poczatek dnia
**"Good morning, sunshine!"** [gud morning, sanszajn] (Dzie≈Ñ dobry, sloneczko!)

### Podczas rozmowy
**"What do you think, honey?"** [≈Çot du ju sink, hani] (Co myslisz, kochanie?)

### Na po≈ºegna≈Ñie
**"See you later, darling!"** [si ju lejter, darling] (Do zobaczenia, kochanie!)

### W wiadomosciach tekstowych
- **"Miss you, babe"** [mis ju, bejb] (Tesknie, kochanie)
- **"Love you, sweetie"** [law ju, s≈Çiti] (Kocham cie, slodka)
- **"Thinking of you, my love"** [sinking of ju, maj law] (Mysle o tobie, kochanie)

## Zdrobnienia do unikania

Niektore zdrobnienia moga byc nieodpowiednie w zaleznosci od kontekstu:

| Zdrobnienie | Uwaga |
|-------------|-------|
| **"hot stuff"** | Moze byc zbyt bezposrednie na poczatku zwiazku |
| **"sexy"** | Uzywaj tylko w prywatnych sytuacjach |
| **"baby girl/boy"** | Niektore osoby moga uznac to za infantylizujace |

<CultureTip title="Szacunek przede wszystkim" flag="üè≥Ô∏è">
Zawsze upewnij sie, ≈ºe twoj partner czuje siƒô komfortowo ≈ºe zdrobnieniem, ktorego uzywasz. To, co jest slodkie dla jednej osoby, moze byc niekomfortowe dla innej!
</CultureTip>

## ƒÜwiczenia dla par

### Gra w zdrobnienia
Kazdy dzie≈Ñ uzywajcie innego zdrobnienia i zobaczcie, ktore wam najbardziej odpowiada!

### Tworzcie w≈Çasne
Najlepsze zdrobnienia to te, ktore maja specjalne znaczenie tylko dla was. Moze to byc wewnetrzny zart lub wspomnienie pierwszej randki.

### Praktyka dzie≈Ñna
Sprobujcie uzywac przynajmniej trzech roznych zdrobnien ka≈ºdego dnia:
1. Rano: **"Good morning, beautiful/handsome"**
2. W ciagu dnia: **"How are you, sweetie?"**
3. Wieczorem: **"Goodnight, my love"**

## Zdrobnienia w kulturze popularnej

Wiele angielskich zdrobnien stalo siƒô znanych dziƒôki filmom i piosenkom:

- **"Here's looking at you, kid"** - Casablanca
- **"Hello, gorgeous"** - Funny Girl
- **"Hey there, Delilah"** - popularna piosenka

## Podsumowanie

Angielskie zdrobnienia dodaja ciepla i intymnosci do codzie≈Ñnej komunikacji. Zacznijcie od klasykow jak "darling" i "honey", a z czasem odkryjecie, ktore zwroty najlepiej pasuja do waszego zwiazku.

Pamietajcie - najwazniejsza jest szczerosc i czulosc, z jaka uzywacuie tych slow. Nawet proste "my love" wypowiedziane z miloscia ma ogromna moc!

## Kontynuuj nauke

- **[Jak powiedziec "kocham cie"](/learn/pl/en/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-english/)** - Romantyczne wyznania
- **[Angielskie powitania](/learn/pl/en/english-greetings-farewells/)** - Codzie≈Ñne zwroty
- **[Slownictwo na randke](/learn/pl/en/english-date-night-vocabulary/)** - Romantyczny s≈Çownik
- **[Podstawy gramatyki](/learn/pl/en/english-grammar-basics/)** - Buduj solidne podstawy

## Od czytania do m√≥wienia

Znasz ju≈º ponad 50 angielskich zdrobnie≈Ñ - ale czy potrafisz je wym√≥wiƒá tak, ≈ºeby tw√≥j partner siƒô rozp≈ÇynƒÖ≈Ç? Wymowa "darling" czy "gorgeous" wymaga praktyki, a najlepiej ƒáwiczyƒá z kim≈õ, kto nie bƒôdzie siƒô ≈õmia≈Ç z twoich pierwszych pr√≥b.

<CTA
  text="Chcesz powiedzieƒá 'honey' z idealnƒÖ wymowƒÖ? Z Love Languages ƒáwiczysz z AI Voice Chat - bez stresu i oceniania. Tw√≥j angielski partner mo≈ºe wysy≈Çaƒá Ci ulubione zdrobnienia jako Word Gifts prosto do Twojego s≈Çownika. Nauka we dwoje dzia≈Ça!"
  buttonText="Ucz siƒô angielskiego z partnerem"
/>

articles.title: 7 Polish Pronunciation Mistakes to Avoid
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Learning Polish pronunciation as an English speaker can feel like navigating a linguistic minefield. But don't worry - even the most common mistakes are completely fixable with practice and patience. Let's tackle the seven pronunciation pitfalls that trip up most English speakers learning Polish together.

<PhraseOfDay
  polish="Powoli ale pewnie"
  english="Slowly but surely"
  pronunciation="po-VO-lee AH-leh PEV-nyeh"
  context="The perfect motto for mastering Polish pronunciation together."
/>

## Mistake #1: Ignoring Nasal Vowels (ƒÖ and ƒô)

The **nos√≥wki** (nasal vowels) **ƒÖ** and **ƒô** are uniquely Polish sounds that don't exist in English. Many learners either skip them entirely or pronounce them as regular vowels.

### The ƒÖ Sound
**ƒÑ** sounds like "aw" with air flowing through your nose. Think of saying "on" in French, but more nasal.

<VocabCard
  polish="mƒÖ≈º"
  english="husband"
  pronunciation="mawzh (nasal)"
  example="M√≥j mƒÖ≈º jest bardzo mi≈Çy." />

<VocabCard
  polish="Dziƒôkujƒô"
  english="Thank you"
  pronunciation="jyen-KOO-yeh"
  example="Dziƒôkujƒô za pomoc, kochanie." />

### The ƒô Sound
**ƒò** is like "en" but nasalized. At the end of words, it often sounds like a regular "e".

| Polish Word | English | Pronunciation | Context |
|---|---|---|---|
| **bƒôdƒô** | I will be | BEN-deh (nasal) | Future tense |
| **serce** | heart | SER-tseh | Note: final ƒô = regular e |
| **imiƒô** | name | EE-myeh | Another final ƒô |

> **Practice Tip:** Put your hand on your nose while saying these sounds. You should feel vibration!

## Mistake #2: Mangling Consonant Clusters

Polish loves to stack consonants together in ways that make English speakers panic. The key is to pronounce every single consonant clearly.

<VocabCard
  polish="szczƒô≈õcie"
  english="happiness"
  pronunciation="SHCH-en-shcheh"
  example="Jeste≈õ moim szczƒô≈õciem." />

**Common Challenging Clusters:**
- **szcz** - like "shch" in "fresh cheese"
- **strz** - "sht-zh" (pronounce the 't' lightly)
- **prz** - "psh" (like "pushes" without the 'u')
- **d≈∫** - soft "j" sound (like 'j' in "jean")

<CultureTip title="Why So Many Consonants?">
Polish consonant clusters often come from Old Slavic roots. Each sound serves a purpose and changes meaning, so skipping them isn't an option!
</CultureTip>

## Mistake #3: Wrong Stress Patterns

English stress is unpredictable, but Polish stress is beautifully simple: **almost always on the second-to-last syllable**.

### Examples of Correct Stress:
- **ko-HA-nie** (darling) - NOT KO-ha-nie
- **mi-≈ÅO-≈õƒá** (love) - NOT MI-≈Ço≈õƒá
- **dzie-KU-jƒô** (thank you) - NOT DZIE-ku-jƒô
- **piƒôk-NA** (beautiful, feminine) - NOT PIƒòK-na

<VocabCard
  polish="mi≈Ço≈õƒá"
  english="love"
  pronunciation="MEE-woshch"
  example="Nasza mi≈Ço≈õƒá jest wieczna." />

## Mistake #4: The Tricky "≈Å" Sound

The **≈Ç** (L with a stroke) is NOT the English "L"! It sounds like the English "W".

**Common Words with ≈Å:**
| Polish | English | Correct Pronunciation | Wrong Pronunciation |
|---|---|---|---|
| **≈Çadna** | beautiful (fem) | WAD-na | LAD-na |
| **≈Ç√≥≈ºko** | bed | WOOZH-ko | LOOZH-ko |
| **bia≈Çy** | white | BYA-wy | BYA-ly |
| **ma≈Ç≈º** | husband (archaic) | mawzh | malzh |

<VocabCard
  polish="≈Çadna"
  english="beautiful (feminine)"
  pronunciation="WAD-na"
  example="Jeste≈õ bardzo ≈Çadna dzi≈õ." />

## Mistake #5: Soft vs. Hard Consonants

Polish distinguishes between **twarde** (hard) and **miƒôkkie** (soft) consonants. The apostrophe (') after a consonant indicates softness.

### Key Soft Consonants:
- **≈õ** - soft "sh" (like "sheep")
- **ƒá** - soft "ch" (like "cheap")
- **≈∫** - soft "zh" (like "pleasure")
- **≈Ñ** - soft "ny" (like Spanish "ni√±o")

<VocabCard
  polish="≈ºycie"
  english="life"
  pronunciation="ZHI-cheh"
  example="Moje ≈ºycie z tobƒÖ jest piƒôkne." />

**Comparison:**
| Hard | Soft | English Equivalent |
|---|---|---|
| **sz** | **≈õ** | "sh" vs. softer "sh" |
| **cz** | **ƒá** | "ch" vs. softer "ch" |
| **≈º/rz** | **≈∫** | "zh" vs. softer "zh" |

## Mistake #6: Rolling the "R" Too Much

Unlike Spanish, Polish **r** should be lightly tapped, not heavily rolled. It's more like a brief trill.

<VocabCard
  polish="pierwsze"
  english="first"
  pronunciation="PYERV-sheh"
  example="To nasze pierwsze spotkanie." />

> **Practice:** Say "butter" quickly in American English - that flapped 't' is similar to Polish 'r'.

## Mistake #7: Vowel Length and Quality

Polish vowels are pure and consistent, unlike English diphthongs.

**Polish vs. English Vowels:**
- **a** - always "ah" (never "ay")
- **e** - always "eh" (never "ee")
- **i** - always "ee" (crisp, not drawn out)
- **o** - always "oh" (never "ow")
- **u/√≥** - always "oo" (never "you")

<VocabCard
  polish="dom"
  english="house/home"
  pronunciation="dom (pure 'o')"
  example="Nasz dom jest pe≈Çen mi≈Ço≈õci." />

## Practice Exercises for Couples

### Daily Pronunciation Drills
1. **Take turns** reading Polish news headlines
2. **Record yourselves** saying pet names
3. **Tongue twisters:** Try **"W Szczebrzeszynie chrzƒÖszcz brzmi w trzcinie"** (In Szczebrzeszyn, a beetle buzzes in the reed)

### Listening Practice
- Watch Polish movies with Polish subtitles
- Listen to Polish podcasts for couples
- Practice with native speaker audio in language apps

<CultureTip title="Be Patient With Each Other">
Remember that pronunciation is muscle memory. It takes time to retrain your mouth to make new sounds. Celebrate small victories and be encouraging when your partner struggles with a particular sound.
</CultureTip>

## The Secret to Success: Consistency

The key to conquering Polish pronunciation isn't perfection from day one - it's **consistent practice**. Spend 10-15 minutes daily working on these sounds together. Make it fun by:

- Creating silly sentences with difficult sounds
- Having pronunciation contests
- Recording progress videos
- Rewarding improvements with Polish treats!

### Essential Words to Master First
| Priority Level | Polish | English | Focus Sound |
|---|---|---|---|
| High | **Cze≈õƒá** | Hi/Bye | cz + ≈õ |
| High | **Dziƒôkujƒô** | Thank you | dzi + ƒô |
| High | **Proszƒô** | Please | sz |
| High | **Kocham ciƒô** | I love you | ƒá |
| Medium | **Szczƒô≈õliwy** | Happy | szcz + ƒô |
| Medium | **≈πr√≥d≈Ço** | Source | ≈∫ + √≥ |

Remember, every Polish speaker will appreciate your effort, even if your pronunciation isn't perfect. The fact that you're trying to learn their beautiful language is what matters most.


<CTA
  text="Ready to Perfect Your Polish Pronunciation Together?"
  buttonText="Start Learning Now"
/>

articles.title: Hungarian Wedding and Anniversary Celebration Vocabulary
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Hungarian Wedding and Anniversary Celebration Vocabulary

Whether you're planning a Hungarian wedding, celebrating an anniversary with your Hungarian partner, or attending a Hungarian couple's special day, knowing the right vocabulary will help you participate fully in these joyous occasions. From proposals to golden anniversaries, this guide covers all the romantic vocabulary you need.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Hozz√°m j√∂ssz feles√©g√ºl?"
  translation="Will you marry me? (to a woman)"
  pronunciation="HOZ-zahm y√∂s FE-le-shay-g√ºl"
  context="The traditional marriage proposal question for men to ask women"
/>

## The Proposal (A L√°nyk√©r√©s)

The magical moment when you ask your partner to marry you requires special vocabulary:

<VocabCard
  word="L√°nyk√©r√©s"
  translation="Marriage proposal (lit. asking for the girl)"
  pronunciation="LAHNY-kay-raysh"
  example="A l√°nyk√©r√©s a Hal√°szb√°sty√°n√°l volt."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hozz√°m j√∂ssz?"
  translation="Will you marry me?"
  pronunciation="HOZ-zahm y√∂s"
  example="Szeretlek. Hozz√°m j√∂ssz?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Igen, akarok!"
  translation="Yes, I do! / Yes, I want to!"
  pronunciation="I-gen AH-kah-rok"
  example="Igen, akarok! Persze, hogy hozz√°d megyek!"
/>

### Proposal Vocabulary

| Hungarian | English | Pronunciation |
|-----------|---------|---------------|
| Eljegyz√©s | Engagement | EL-yedy-zaysh |
| Eljegyezni | To get engaged | EL-ye-dyez-ni |
| Jegygy≈±r≈± | Engagement ring | YEDY-dy≈±-r≈± |
| Gy√©m√°nt | Diamond | DYAY-mahnt |
| Let√©rdelni | To kneel down | LE-tayr-del-ni |
| Megk√©rni a kez√©t | To ask for one's hand | MEG-kayr-ni ah KE-zayt |
| Menyasszony | Fianc√©e/Bride | ME-nyahs-sony |
| V≈ëleg√©ny | Fianc√©/Groom | V≈ê-le-gayny |

<CultureTip title="Hungarian Proposal Traditions" flag="üá≠üá∫">
In traditional Hungarian culture, it was customary for the man to formally ask the woman's father for permission before proposing. While this is becoming less common in modern times, some couples still appreciate this respectful gesture. The proposal is called "l√°nyk√©r√©s" (asking for the girl), reflecting these traditional roots.
</CultureTip>

## Wedding Vocabulary (Esk√ºv≈ëi Sz√≥kincs)

### Essential Wedding Terms

<VocabCard
  word="Esk√ºv≈ë"
  translation="Wedding"
  pronunciation="ESH-k√º-v≈ë"
  example="Az esk√ºv≈ënk j√∫niusban lesz."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="H√°zass√°g"
  translation="Marriage"
  pronunciation="HAH-zahs-shahg"
  example="Boldog h√°zass√°got k√≠v√°nok!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="H√°zast√°rs"
  translation="Spouse"
  pronunciation="HAH-zahsh-tahrsh"
  example="≈ê az √©n h√°zast√°rsam."
/>

| Hungarian | English | Pronunciation |
|-----------|---------|---------------|
| Feles√©g | Wife | FE-le-shayg |
| F√©rj | Husband | Fayrj |
| Menyasszony | Bride | ME-nyahs-sony |
| V≈ëleg√©ny | Groom | V≈ê-le-gayny |
| Tan√∫ | Witness | TAH-n√∫ |
| Koszor√∫sl√°ny | Bridesmaid | KO-so-r√∫sh-lahny |
| V≈ëf√©ly | Best man | V≈ê-fayly |
| N√°szn√©p | Wedding guests | NAHSS-nayp |
| Any√≥s | Mother-in-law | AH-ny√≥sh |
| Ap√≥s | Father-in-law | AH-p√≥sh |

### The Ceremony (A Szertart√°s)

<VocabCard
  word="Polg√°ri esk√ºv≈ë"
  translation="Civil wedding"
  pronunciation="POL-gah-ri ESH-k√º-v≈ë"
  example="El≈ësz√∂r polg√°ri esk√ºv≈ët tartunk."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Templomi esk√ºv≈ë"
  translation="Church wedding"
  pronunciation="TEM-plo-mi ESH-k√º-v≈ë"
  example="A templomi esk√ºv≈ë a nagymam√°nak fontos."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Fogadom"
  translation="I do / I promise"
  pronunciation="FO-gah-dom"
  example="Igen, fogadom."
/>

| Ceremony Terms | English | Pronunciation |
|---------------|---------|---------------|
| Esk√º | Vow | ESH-k√º |
| H√°zass√°gi fogadalom | Marriage vows | HAH-zahs-shah-gi FO-gah-dah-lom |
| Karikagy≈±r≈± | Wedding ring | KAH-ri-kah-dy≈±-r≈± |
| Gy≈±r≈±csere | Ring exchange | DY≈∞-r≈±-che-re |
| Anyak√∂nyvvezet≈ë | Registrar | AH-nyah-k√∂nyv-ve-ze-t≈ë |
| Pap | Priest | Pahp |
| Olt√°r | Altar | OL-tahr |
| Mise | Mass | MI-she |
| √Åld√°s | Blessing | AHL-dahsh |
| Cs√≥k | Kiss | Ch√≥k |

<CultureTip title="Two Ceremonies" flag="üá≠üá∫">
In Hungary, couples often have two wedding ceremonies: a civil ceremony (polg√°ri esk√ºv≈ë) at the town hall, which is legally required, and a religious ceremony (templomi esk√ºv≈ë) at church. The civil ceremony is typically smaller, with the church wedding being the grand celebration.
</CultureTip>

### The Reception (A Lakodalom)

<VocabCard
  word="Lakodalom"
  translation="Wedding reception/feast"
  pronunciation="LAH-ko-dah-lom"
  example="A lakodalom reggelig tartott!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Menyasszonyt√°nc"
  translation="Bride's dance"
  pronunciation="ME-nyahs-sony-tahnts"
  example="A menyasszonyt√°nc egy hagyom√°ny."
/>

| Reception Vocabulary | English | Pronunciation |
|---------------------|---------|---------------|
| Esk√ºv≈ëi torta | Wedding cake | ESH-k√º-v≈ë-i TOR-tah |
| Asztali besz√©d | Speech/Toast | AHS-tah-li BE-sayd |
| Poh√°rk√∂sz√∂nt≈ë | Toast | PO-hahr-k√∂-s√∂n-t≈ë |
| Zenekar | Band | ZE-ne-kar |
| Els≈ë t√°nc | First dance | EL-s≈ë tahnts |
| Vir√°gcsokor | Bouquet | VI-rahg-cho-kor |
| Csokordob√°s | Bouquet toss | CHO-kor-do-bahsh |
| Menyasszonyi ruha | Wedding dress | ME-nyahs-sony-i RU-hah |
| √ñlt√∂ny | Suit | √ñL-t√∂ny |
| Vend√©gek | Guests | VEN-day-gek |

## Wedding Wishes and Congratulations

<VocabCard
  word="Gratul√°lok az esk√ºv≈ëh√∂z!"
  translation="Congratulations on your wedding!"
  pronunciation="GRAH-tu-lah-lok ahz ESH-k√º-v≈ë-h√∂z"
  example="Gratul√°lok az esk√ºv≈ëh√∂z! Nagyon boldogok vagytok!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sok boldogs√°got!"
  translation="Much happiness!"
  pronunciation="Shok BOL-dog-shah-got"
  example="Sok boldogs√°got k√≠v√°nok nektek!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Isten √©ltessen!"
  translation="God bless you! (Long life!)"
  pronunciation="ISH-ten AYL-tesh-shen"
  example="Isten √©ltessen benneteket!"
/>

### Wedding Wishes Table

| Hungarian | English | When to Use |
|-----------|---------|-------------|
| Boldog h√°zass√°got! | Happy marriage! | General wish |
| Sok boldogs√°got √©s szeretetet! | Much happiness and love! | Heartfelt wish |
| √âljetek boldogan! | Live happily! | Traditional |
| √ñr√∂k szerelmet k√≠v√°nok! | I wish you eternal love! | Romantic |
| Isten √°ld√°sa legyen rajtatok! | God's blessing upon you! | Religious |
| Csod√°latos √©letet k√≠v√°nok egy√ºtt! | Wishing you a wonderful life together! | Warm wish |

## Anniversary Vocabulary (√âvfordul√≥)

### Basic Anniversary Terms

<VocabCard
  word="H√°zass√°gi √©vfordul√≥"
  translation="Wedding anniversary"
  pronunciation="HAH-zahs-shah-gi AYV-for-du-l√≥"
  example="Boldog h√°zass√°gi √©vfordul√≥t!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√âvfordul√≥nk van"
  translation="It's our anniversary"
  pronunciation="AYV-for-du-l√≥nk vahn"
  example="Ma √©vfordul√≥nk van - √∂t √©ve h√°zasodtunk."
/>

| Hungarian | English | Pronunciation |
|-----------|---------|---------------|
| Els≈ë √©vfordul√≥ | First anniversary | EL-s≈ë AYV-for-du-l√≥ |
| Pap√≠resk√ºv≈ë | Paper wedding (1 year) | PAH-p√≠r-esh-k√º-v≈ë |
| Faesk√ºv≈ë | Wood wedding (5 years) | FAH-esh-k√º-v≈ë |
| √ìn√©vfordul√≥ | Tin anniversary (10 years) | √ìN-ayv-for-du-l√≥ |
| Krist√°lyesk√ºv≈ë | Crystal wedding (15 years) | KRISH-tahy-esh-k√º-v≈ë |
| Porcel√°n esk√ºv≈ë | Porcelain wedding (20 years) | POR-tse-lahn ESH-k√º-v≈ë |
| Ez√ºstesk√ºv≈ë | Silver wedding (25 years) | E-z√ºsht-esh-k√º-v≈ë |
| Gy√∂ngyesk√ºv≈ë | Pearl wedding (30 years) | DY√ñNDY-esh-k√º-v≈ë |
| Rubinesk√ºv≈ë | Ruby wedding (40 years) | RU-bin-esh-k√º-v≈ë |
| Aranyesk√ºv≈ë | Golden wedding (50 years) | AH-rahny-esh-k√º-v≈ë |
| Gy√©m√°ntesk√ºv≈ë | Diamond wedding (60 years) | DYAY-mahnt-esh-k√º-v≈ë |

<CultureTip title="Hungarian Anniversary Names" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Each anniversary has a traditional name in Hungarian, usually related to a material that symbolizes the strength and nature of the relationship at that stage. The "aranyesk√ºv≈ë" (golden wedding - 50 years) is particularly celebrated, often with a renewal of vows ceremony.
</CultureTip>

### Anniversary Messages

<VocabCard
  word="Boldog √©vfordul√≥t, szerelmem!"
  translation="Happy anniversary, my love!"
  pronunciation="BOL-dog AYV-for-du-l√≥t SE-rel-mem"
  example="Boldog √©vfordul√≥t, szerelmem! Ez a legjobb √∂t √©v volt!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="K√∂sz√∂n√∂m ezt a csod√°latos X √©vet!"
  translation="Thank you for these wonderful X years!"
  pronunciation="K√ñ-s√∂-n√∂m est ah CHO-dah-lah-tosh [number] AY-vet"
  example="K√∂sz√∂n√∂m ezt a csod√°latos t√≠z √©vet!"
/>

| Anniversary Message | Translation |
|-------------------|-------------|
| Mindig szeretlek | I will always love you |
| Veled akarom t√∂lteni az √©letemet | I want to spend my life with you |
| Te vagy az √©letem szerelme | You are the love of my life |
| H√°l√°s vagyok minden nap√©rt veled | I'm grateful for every day with you |
| Egy√ºtt √∂reged√ºnk meg | We'll grow old together |
| √öjra √©s √∫jra t√©ged v√°lasztan√°lak | I'd choose you again and again |

## Romantic Celebration Phrases

<VocabCard
  word="Eml√©kszel az els≈ë tal√°lkoz√°sunkra?"
  translation="Do you remember when we first met?"
  pronunciation="EM-layk-sel ahz EL-s≈ë TAH-lahl-ko-zah-shunk-rah"
  example="Eml√©kszel az els≈ë tal√°lkoz√°sunkra? Olyan ideges voltam!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ez a legszebb napom"
  translation="This is my most beautiful day"
  pronunciation="Ez ah LEG-sebb NAH-pom"
  example="Ez a legszebb napom, mert itt vagy velem."
/>

| Romantic Phrase | Translation | Occasion |
|----------------|-------------|----------|
| √ñr√∂kk√© szeretlek | I will love you forever | Wedding/Anniversary |
| A sz√≠vem √∂r√∂kre a ti√©d | My heart is forever yours | Vows/Anniversary |
| Veled minden nap k√ºl√∂nleges | Every day is special with you | Any celebration |
| Megv√°ltozott az √©letem, mi√≥ta megismertelek | My life changed since I met you | Anniversary |
| Te vagy a legjobb d√∂nt√©sem | You are my best decision | Wedding/Anniversary |
| √öjra megtenn√©k mindent | I would do it all again | Anniversary |

## Traditional Hungarian Wedding Customs

Understanding Hungarian wedding traditions will help you participate fully:

### Menyasszonyt√°nc (Bride's Dance)

<VocabCard
  word="Menyasszonyt√°nc"
  translation="Bride's dance (money dance)"
  pronunciation="ME-nyahs-sony-tahnts"
  example="A menyasszonyt√°ncn√°l a vend√©gek p√©nzt adnak a menyasszonynak."
/>

During this tradition, male guests pay to dance with the bride, and the collected money goes to the newlyweds.

### V≈ëf√©ly (Master of Ceremonies)

<VocabCard
  word="V≈ëf√©ly"
  translation="Traditional wedding MC/Best man"
  pronunciation="V≈ê-fayly"
  example="A v≈ëf√©ly mondja a rigmusokat az esk√ºv≈ën."
/>

The v≈ëf√©ly traditionally leads the wedding festivities, reciting poems and verses throughout the celebration.

### Traditional Phrases

| Tradition | Hungarian | English |
|-----------|-----------|---------|
| Before eating | J√≥ √©tv√°gyat! | Enjoy your meal! |
| Toast | Eg√©szs√©getekre! | To your health! |
| Blessing | Isten √°ldjon! | God bless you! |
| Wishing well | Sok boldogs√°got! | Much happiness! |
| Traditional cheer | √âljen az ifj√∫ p√°r! | Long live the newlyweds! |

<CultureTip title="The Wedding Feast" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Traditional Hungarian weddings feature elaborate multi-course meals with dishes like t√∂lt√∂tt k√°poszta (stuffed cabbage), guly√°s, and various roasted meats. The celebration often continues until dawn with music, dancing, and plenty of p√°linka toasts!
</CultureTip>

## Planning Your Celebration

<VocabCard
  word="Hov√° menj√ºnk √ºnnepelni?"
  translation="Where should we go to celebrate?"
  pronunciation="HO-vah MEN-y√ºnk √úN-ne-pel-ni"
  example="Hov√° menj√ºnk √ºnnepelni az √©vfordul√≥nkat?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Foglaljunk asztalt?"
  translation="Should we book a table?"
  pronunciation="FOG-lahl-yunk AHS-tahlt"
  example="Foglaljunk asztalt a kedvenc √©tterem√ºnkben?"
/>

### Celebration Planning Vocabulary

| Hungarian | English | Pronunciation |
|-----------|---------|---------------|
| Meglepet√©s | Surprise | MEG-le-pe-taysh |
| Aj√°nd√©k | Gift | AH-yahn-dayk |
| Vir√°g | Flowers | VI-rahg |
| Pezsg≈ë | Champagne | PEZ-g≈ë |
| Romantikus vacsora | Romantic dinner | RO-mahn-ti-kush VAH-cho-rah |
| Gyertya | Candle | DYER-tyah |
| √únnepelni | To celebrate | √úN-ne-pel-ni |
| Eml√©kek | Memories | EM-lay-kek |
| F√©nyk√©p | Photo | FAYNY-kayp |
| N√°sz√∫t | Honeymoon | NAHS-√∫t |

## Sample Anniversary Conversation

**Partner A:** Boldog √©vfordul√≥t, szerelmem!
*Happy anniversary, my love!*

**Partner B:** Neked is! Nem hiszem el, hogy m√°r √∂t √©ve h√°zasok vagyunk!
*You too! I can't believe we've been married for five years!*

**Partner A:** Eml√©kszem az esk√ºv≈ënkre, mintha tegnap lett volna.
*I remember our wedding like it was yesterday.*

**Partner B:** Olyan gy√∂ny√∂r≈± nap volt. √âs te olyan j√≥k√©p≈± volt√°l az √∂lt√∂ny√∂dben!
*It was such a beautiful day. And you looked so handsome in your suit!*

**Partner A:** Te volt√°l a legszebb menyasszony. K√∂sz√∂n√∂m ezt az √∂t √©vet!
*You were the most beautiful bride. Thank you for these five years!*

**Partner B:** K√∂sz√∂n√∂m neked! Veled akarom t√∂lteni az √©letem h√°tral√©v≈ë r√©sz√©t.
*Thank you! I want to spend the rest of my life with you.*

**Partner A:** Szeretlek. Gyer√ºnk √ºnnepelni!
*I love you. Let's go celebrate!*

## Quick Reference Card

| Occasion | Hungarian | English |
|----------|-----------|---------|
| Proposal | Hozz√°m j√∂ssz? | Will you marry me? |
| Acceptance | Igen! | Yes! |
| At the altar | Fogadom | I do |
| Wedding wish | Sok boldogs√°got! | Much happiness! |
| Anniversary | Boldog √©vfordul√≥t! | Happy anniversary! |
| Toast | Eg√©szs√©getekre! | To your health! |
| Declaration | √ñr√∂kk√© szeretlek | I'll love you forever |

Your journey through love's milestones with your Hungarian partner will be enriched by knowing these special words and phrases. Whether you're saying "fogadom" at the altar or celebrating your aranyesk√ºv≈ë after 50 years together, these expressions will help you share in the joy of your Hungarian traditions.

<CTA text="Ready to learn more Hungarian for your special occasions?" buttonText="Start Your Hungarian Journey" />

articles.title: Schwedische Aussprache: Ein Leitfaden f√ºr Deutsche
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Schwedische Aussprache: Ein Leitfaden f√ºr Deutsche

Die schwedische Aussprache hat eine besondere Melodie, die die Sprache so charmant macht. Als deutscher Muttersprachler hast du viele Vorteile - aber es gibt auch einige neue Laute zu lernen.

## Die wichtigste Regel

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Schwedisch hat einen singenden Tonfall"
  translation="Die Betonung und Melodie sind entscheidend f√ºr das Verst√§ndnis"
  context="Schwedisch ist eine 'tonale' Sprache mit zwei verschiedenen Akzenten."
/>

## Das schwedische Alphabet

Das schwedische Alphabet hat 29 Buchstaben - die deutschen plus drei:

| Buchstabe | Aussprache | Wie im Deutschen |
|-----------|------------|------------------|
| **A a** | a | wie "a" in "Vater" |
| **B b** | be | wie "b" in "Ball" |
| **C c** | se | vor e, i, y = "s", sonst "k" |
| **D d** | de | wie "d" in "Dach" |
| **E e** | e | kurz wie "e" in "Bett" |
| **F f** | ef | wie "f" in "Fisch" |
| **G g** | ge | vor e, i, y, √§, √∂ = weiches "j" |
| **H h** | ho | wie "h" in "Haus" |
| **I i** | i | wie "i" in "Kino" |
| **J j** | ji | wie "j" in "ja" |
| **K k** | ko | vor e, i, y, √§, √∂ = "sch" |
| **L l** | el | wie "l" in "Lampe" |
| **M m** | em | wie "m" in "Mutter" |
| **N n** | en | wie "n" in "Nase" |
| **O o** | u | wie "u" in "Hund" (!) |
| **P p** | pe | wie "p" in "Park" |
| **Q q** | ku | selten, wie "kv" |
| **R r** | √§r | gerollt oder uvular |
| **S s** | es | wie "ss" in "Wasser" |
| **T t** | te | wie "t" in "Tisch" |
| **U u** | u | speziell - zwischen √º und u |
| **V v** | ve | wie "w" in "Wasser" |
| **W w** | dubbel-ve | wie "v" |
| **X x** | eks | wie "ks" |
| **Y y** | y | wie "√º" in "Gl√ºck" |
| **Z z** | s√§ta | wie "s" |
| **√Ö √•** | o | wie "o" in "offen" |
| **√Ñ √§** | √§ | wie "√§" in "B√§r" |
| **√ñ √∂** | √∂ | wie "√∂" in "sch√∂n" |

<CultureTip title="Die drei Extrabuchstaben" flag="üá∏üá™">
√Ö, √Ñ, √ñ stehen am ENDE des schwedischen Alphabets, nicht bei A und O! Sie werden als eigenst√§ndige Buchstaben behandelt, nicht als A/O mit Umlaut.
</CultureTip>

## Vokale

### Kurze und lange Vokale

Im Schwedischen sind Vokall√§ngen bedeutungsunterscheidend:

| Kurz | Lang | Bedeutung |
|------|------|-----------|
| **matt** | **mat** | matt / Essen |
| **glass** | **glas** | Eis / Glas |
| **full** | **ful** | voll / h√§sslich |

### Besondere Vokale

<VocabCard
  word="U - Das schwedische U"
  translation="Ein Laut zwischen deutschem '√º' und 'u'"
  pronunciation="Lippen rund wie bei 'u', Zunge wie bei 'i'"
  example="hus (Haus), slut (Ende), du (du)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="O - Klingt wie deutsches U!"
  translation="Schwedisches 'o' = deutsches 'u'"
  pronunciation="u"
  example="bord (Tisch) klingt wie 'burd', god (gut) wie 'gud'"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√Ö - Das offene O"
  translation="Wie deutsches 'o' in 'offen'"
  pronunciation="o"
  example="√•r (Jahr), b√•t (Boot), g√• (gehen)"
/>

## Konsonanten

### Weiche Konsonanten vor e, i, y, √§, √∂

<VocabCard
  word="K vor e, i, y, √§, √∂"
  translation="Wird zu 'sch' (ungef√§hr)"
  pronunciation="Ein Laut zwischen 'ch' und 'sch'"
  example="k√∂pa (kaufen), kyss (Kuss), k√§rlek (Liebe)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="G vor e, i, y, √§, √∂"
  translation="Wird zu weichem 'j'"
  pronunciation="j"
  example="g√∂ra (machen), g√§rna (gerne)"
/>

| Buchstabe | Vor a, o, u, √• | Vor e, i, y, √§, √∂ |
|-----------|----------------|-------------------|
| **K** | k | "sch"-√§hnlich |
| **G** | g | weiches "j" |
| **SK** | sk | "sch" |

### Das schwedische SJ-Laut

<VocabCard
  word="SJ / SK / STJ / SKJ"
  translation="Der 'sje'-Laut"
  pronunciation="Ein tiefer 'sch'-Laut aus der Kehle"
  example="sj√∂ (See), sju (sieben), sk√∂n (sch√∂n), stj√§rna (Stern)"
/>

Dieser Laut ist einzigartig im Schwedischen - eine Art tiefes "sch" das fast wie "hu" oder "hw" klingt.

<CultureTip title="Regionale Unterschiede" flag="üá∏üá™">
Der SJ-Laut variiert stark je nach Region. In Stockholm ist er sehr kehlig ("hw"), in S√ºdschweden klingt er mehr wie deutsches "sch". Beide sind korrekt!
</CultureTip>

### Das schwedische R

<VocabCard
  word="R - Regional verschieden"
  translation="Im S√ºden uvular, im Norden gerollt"
  pronunciation="Wie deutsches/franz√∂sisches R oder gerollt"
  example="r√∂d (rot), tre (drei), r√§tt (richtig)"
/>

### RS, RT, RD, RN, RL

Diese Kombinationen verschmelzen zu "retroflexen" Lauten:

| Kombination | Aussprache | Beispiel |
|-------------|------------|----------|
| **RS** | "sch" | vars√•god ‚Üí var-scho-god |
| **RT** | "·π≠" | svart ‚Üí sva·π≠ |
| **RD** | "·∏ç" | bord ‚Üí bo·∏ç |
| **RN** | "·πá" | barn ‚Üí ba·πá |

## Die schwedische Melodie

Schwedisch hat zwei "Tonakzente" (Akzent 1 und Akzent 2):

<VocabCard
  word="Akzent 1 vs. Akzent 2"
  translation="Unterschiedliche Melodien unterscheiden Bedeutungen"
  example="anden (die Ente) vs. anden (der Geist) - gleich geschrieben, unterschiedliche Melodie!"
/>

Akzent 1: Fallend ‚Üò
Akzent 2: Fallend-steigend ‚Üò‚Üó

Mach dir keine Sorgen - das kommt mit der √úbung!

## √úbung: Romantische W√∂rter

<VocabCard
  word="Jag √§lskar dig"
  translation="Ich liebe dich"
  pronunciation="jag EL-skar dej"
  example="Das 'g' in 'jag' ist stumm, 'dig' wird 'dej' ausgesprochen."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√Ñlskling"
  translation="Liebling"
  pronunciation="ELS-kling"
  example="Das '√§' ist wie deutsches '√§', 'sk' vor 'l' bleibt 'sk'."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Puss"
  translation="Kuss"
  pronunciation="pus"
  example="Kurzes 'u' (zwischen √º und u)."
/>

## H√§ufige Aussprachefehler

| Fehler | Richtig | Tipp |
|--------|---------|------|
| "o" wie deutsches "o" | "o" = "u" | god = gud |
| "k" immer wie "k" | "k" vor e,i,y,√§,√∂ = "sch" | k√§rlek = sch√§rlek |
| "g" immer wie "g" | "g" vor e,i,y,√§,√∂ = "j" | g√∂ra = j√∂ra |
| "u" wie deutsches "u" | Zwischen √º und u | Lippen rund, Zunge hoch |

## √úbungss√§tze

| Schwedisch | Langsame Aussprache | Deutsch |
|------------|---------------------|---------|
| **God morgon** | gud MOR-ron | Guten Morgen |
| **Jag √§lskar dig** | jag EL-skar dej | Ich liebe dich |
| **Hur m√•r du?** | hur mor du | Wie geht's? |
| **Du √§r vacker** | du √§r VA-ker | Du bist sch√∂n |
| **God natt** | gud nat | Gute Nacht |

## Schnellreferenz

**Besondere Vokale:**
- O = u | √Ö = o | U = zwischen √º und u | Y = √º

**Weiche Konsonanten (vor e, i, y, √§, √∂):**
- K = "sch"-√§hnlich | G = weiches "j" | SK = "sch"

**Der SJ-Laut:**
- SJ, SKJ, STJ = tiefer "sch"-Laut aus der Kehle

Mit etwas √úbung wirst du die schwedische Melodie meistern!

<CTA />

articles.title: Ingilizce Selamlasmalar ve Vedalasma Ifadeleri: Ciftler Icin Rehber
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Selamlasmalar ve vedalaslar, her dilde iletisimin temel taslaridir. Partnerinizle Ingilizce √∂greniyor olmaniz, bu ifadeleri √∂zel ve romantik kilabilir. Her **"Good morning, love"** [gud mornin, lav] (G√ºnaydƒ±n, askim) ile g√ºne g√ºzel baslayabilir, her **"See you later, darling"** [si yu leyter, darlin] (Sonra g√∂r√ºs√ºr√ºz, sevgilim) ile vedalasmalarinizi tatlilestirebilirsiniz.

## Temel Ingilizce Selamlasmalar

<VocabCard
  word="Hello"
  translation="Merhaba"
  pronunciation="helo"
  example="Hello, my love! How are you today?"
/>

### G√ºn√ºn Saatine G√∂re Selamlasmalar

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce | Ne Zaman Kullanilir |
|-----------|---------|--------|---------------------|
| **Good morning** | gud mornin | G√ºnaydƒ±n | Sabah saatleri |
| **Good afternoon** | gud afternu:n | Iyi g√ºnler | √ñgle sonrasi |
| **Good evening** | gud ivnin | Iyi aksamlar | Aksam saatleri |
| **Good night** | gud nayt | Iyi geceler | Yatmadan √∂nce |

<CultureTip title="Ingilizce Selamlasma K√ºlt√ºr√º" flag="üá¨üáß">
Ingilizce konusan √ºlkelerde, √∂zellikle Ingiltere'de, "How do you do?" gibi resmi selamlasmalar kullanilir. Ancak yakin iliskilerde ve ciftler arasinda daha sicak ifadeler tercih edilir. Amerika'da ise "Hey!" veya "Hi!" gibi daha rahat ifadeler yaygindir.
</CultureTip>

## Ciftler Icin Romantik Selamlasmalar

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Good morning, beautiful"
  translation="G√ºnaydƒ±n, g√ºzelim"
  pronunciation="gud mornin, byutiful"
  context="Sabah uyandƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±zda partnerinize s√∂yleyebileceƒüiniz romantik bir selamlama"
/>

### Sevdiceginize √ñzel Selamlasmalar

<VocabCard
  word="Hello, my love"
  translation="Merhaba, askim"
  pronunciation="helo, may lav"
  example="Hello, my love! I missed you so much."
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **Hi, sweetheart** | hay, swiit-hart | Selam, tatliim |
| **Hey, honey** | hey, hani | Selam, balim |
| **Hello, darling** | helo, darlin | Merhaba, sevgilim |
| **Good morning, sunshine** | gud mornin, sansayn | G√ºnaydƒ±n, g√ºnes isigim |
| **Hi there, gorgeous** | hay der, gorcis | Selam, g√ºzelim |

## Samimi Selamlasma Ifadeleri

<VocabCard
  word="How are you doing?"
  translation="Nasil gidiyor? / Nasilsin?"
  pronunciation="hav ar yu duin"
  example="Hey babe, how are you doing today?"
/>

### Hal Hatir Sorma

- **"How's it going?"** [havz it goin] (Nasil gidiyor?)
- **"How have you been?"** [hav hev yu bin] (Nasildin?)
- **"What's up?"** [vats ap] (Ne var ne yok?)
- **"How was your day?"** [hav vaz yor dey] (G√ºn√ºn nasil gecti?)

<CultureTip title="'How are you?' Sorusuna Cevap" flag="üá∫üá∏">
Ingilizce'de "How are you?" sorusu bazen sadece bir selamlama olarak kullanilir ve detayli bir cevap beklenmez. Ancak yakin iliskilerinizde gercekten nasil oldugunuzu paylasabilirsiniz. Ciftler arasinda "I'm better now that you're here" (Sen yanƒ±mdayken daha iyiyim) gibi romantik cevaplar kullanilabilir.
</CultureTip>

## Temel Vedalasmalar

<VocabCard
  word="Goodbye"
  translation="Hosca kal / G√ºle g√ºle"
  pronunciation="gudbay"
  example="Goodbye, my love. See you tonight!"
/>

### G√ºnl√ºk Vedalasmalar

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **Bye** | bay | Hosca kal |
| **Bye-bye** | bay-bay | Bye bye |
| **See you later** | si yu leyter | Sonra g√∂r√ºs√ºr√ºz |
| **See you soon** | si yu su:n | Yakinda g√∂r√ºs√ºr√ºz |
| **Take care** | teyk ker | Kendine iyi bak |
| **Have a good day** | hev e gud dey | Iyi g√ºnler |

## Ciftler Icin Romantik Vedalasma Ifadeleri

<PhraseOfDay
  word="I'll miss you"
  translation="Seni √∂zleyecegim"
  pronunciation="ayl mis yu"
  context="Partnerinizden ayrƒ±lƒ±rken s√∂yleyebileceƒüiniz duygusal bir ifade"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Can't wait to see you again"
  translation="Seni tekrar g√∂rmek icin sabƒ±rsƒ±zlanƒ±yorum"
  pronunciation="kent veyt tu si yu egen"
  example="Goodbye, darling. Can't wait to see you again!"
/>

### Sevgilinize √ñzel Vedalasma Ifadeleri

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **I love you, see you later** | ay lav yu, si yu leyter | Seni seviyorum, sonra g√∂r√ºs√ºr√ºz |
| **Miss you already** | mis yu olredi | Simdiden √∂zledim |
| **Hurry back** | h√∂ri bek | Cabuk d√∂n |
| **Dream of me** | dri:m ov mi | Beni r√ºyanda g√∂r |
| **Sweet dreams, my love** | sviit dri:mz, may lav | Tatli r√ºyalar, askim |

## Gece Vedalasmalari

<VocabCard
  word="Good night, sleep tight"
  translation="Iyi geceler, tatli r√ºyalar"
  pronunciation="gud nayt, sli:p tayt"
  example="Good night, sleep tight, my darling."
/>

### Yatmadan √ñnceki Ifadeler

- **"Sweet dreams"** [sviit dri:mz] (Tatli r√ºyalar)
- **"Sleep well"** [sli:p vel] (Iyi uykular)
- **"Nighty night"** [nayti nayt] (Iyi geceler - sevimli s√∂yleyis)
- **"See you in the morning"** [si yu in ze mornin] (Sabah g√∂r√ºs√ºr√ºz)
- **"I'll dream of you"** [ayl dri:m ov yu] (Seni r√ºyamda g√∂r√ºr√ºm)

<CultureTip title="Ingilizce Gece Vedalasmalari" flag="üá¨üáß">
"Sleep tight" ifadesinin k√∂keni eski yataklara dayanir - yataklar ip ile gerilirdi ve "tight" (siki) baglanmasi rahat uyku anlamina gelirdi. Bug√ºn romantik ve sicak bir ifade olarak kullanilmaktadir.
</CultureTip>

## Telefonla Selamlasma ve Vedalasma

<VocabCard
  word="Hey, it's me"
  translation="Selam, benim"
  pronunciation="hey, its mi"
  example="Hey, it's me. Just wanted to hear your voice."
/>

### Telefon Konusmasi Ifadeleri

| Durum | Ingilizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|-------|-----------|---------|--------|
| Arama | **Hello?** | helo? | Alo? |
| Tanisma | **It's me, love** | its mi, lav | Benim, askim |
| Kapatma | **Talk to you later** | tok tu yu leyter | Sonra konusuruz |
| √ñzlem | **I miss your voice** | ay mis yor voys | Sesini √∂zledim |

## √ñzel G√ºnler Icin Selamlasmalar

### Dogum G√ºn√º

<VocabCard
  word="Happy birthday, my love"
  translation="Dogum g√ºn√ºn kutlu olsun, askim"
  pronunciation="hepi b√∂rzdey, may lav"
  example="Happy birthday, my love! You mean everything to me."
/>

### √ñzel Anlar

- **"Happy anniversary"** [hepi eniverseri] (Yil√∂n√ºm√ºm√ºz kutlu olsun)
- **"Congratulations, darling"** [kongrec√ºleysƒ±nz, darlin] (Tebrikler, sevgilim)
- **"Merry Christmas, sweetheart"** [meri krismes, sviit-hart] (Mutlu Noeller, tatliim)
- **"Happy New Year, my love"** [hepi nyu yir, may lav] (Mutlu yillar, askim)

## Ciftler Icin Pratik Senaryo

### Sabah Rutini
1. **"Good morning, beautiful/handsome"** [gud mornin, byutiful/hendsam] (G√ºnaydƒ±n, g√ºzelim/yakisiklim)
2. **"Did you sleep well?"** [did yu sli:p vel] (Iyi uyudun mu?)
3. **"I love you"** [ay lav yu] (Seni seviyorum)

### Isten Cikarken
1. **"I'm heading out"** [aym hedin aut] (Cikiyorum)
2. **"Have a great day, honey"** [hev e greyt dey, hani] (Harika bir g√ºn gecir, tatliim)
3. **"I'll miss you"** [ayl mis yu] (Seni √∂zleyecegim)
4. **"See you tonight"** [si yu tunayt] (Bu gece g√∂r√ºs√ºr√ºz)

### Eve D√∂nd√ºg√ºnde
1. **"I'm home!"** [aym houm] (Geldim!)
2. **"I missed you"** [ay mist yu] (Seni √∂zledim)
3. **"How was your day?"** [hav vaz yor dey] (G√ºn√ºn nasil gecti?)

## Telaffuz Ipuclari

1. **"Th" sesi**: "The" ve "that" kelimelerindeki "th" icin dilinizi dislerinizin arasina koyun
2. **Kisa sesler**: "Good" kelimesindeki "oo" kisa bir "u" sesidir
3. **Baglama**: Ingilizce'de kelimeler birbirine baglanir - "See you" "siyu" gibi s√∂ylenir

<CultureTip title="Samimiyet ve Selamlasma" flag="üá∫üá∏">
Ingilizce konusan k√ºlt√ºrlerde, ozellikle Amerika'da, tanidiklarla g√∂z temasi kurarak gulumsemek √∂nemlidir. Ciftler arasinda ise bir √∂p√ºc√ºk veya sarilma ile selamlasma cok yaygindir.
</CultureTip>

## Ingilizce Selamlasma ve Vedalasmada Ustalasmak

Her g√ºn bu ifadeleri partnerinizle kullanarak pratik yapin:

1. **Sabah**: Birbirinize Ingilizce "Good morning" deyin
2. **G√ºn icinde**: Mesajlasmalarƒ±nƒ±zda "Hey, love" kullanin
3. **Aksam**: "Good night, sweet dreams" ile g√ºn√ºn√ºz√º bitirin

Ingilizce selamlasma ve vedalasma ifadelerini √∂grenmek, g√ºnl√ºk hayatiniza romantik bir dokunuss katar. Her **"Hello, my love"** ve **"Goodbye, darling"** iliskinizi g√ºclendirirken Ingilizce becerilerinizi de gelistirir.

## √ñƒürenmeye Devam Et

- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Telaffuz](/learn/tr/en/english-pronunciation-guide/)** - Sesleri √∂ƒürenin
- **[Temel ƒ∞ngilizce ƒ∞fadeler](/learn/tr/en/english-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Pratik ileti≈üim
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Zor mu?](/learn/tr/en/is-english-hard-to-learn/)** - D√ºr√ºst analiz
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Selamla≈ümalar](/learn/tr/en/english-greetings-farewells/)** - Temel konu≈üma

<CTA text="Partnerinizle birlikte Ingilizce √∂ƒürenmeye hazƒ±r mƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z?" buttonText="Hemen Ba≈ülayƒ±n" />
